definition: to try to persuade sb to give up (their job, plans etc)
to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
consultant who breaks up sb's extramarital relationship for a fee

sentences.english: I flunked out because I am autistic.
sentences.chinese: 我被勸退也因爲患有孤獨症。

definition: to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to be transferred to another post/to post away
inexperienced/junior (employee etc)
to deceive/to conceal
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
abuse of authority
reparations/to pay reparations
to be stuck/to feel stuck
to threaten/to blackmail
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to fire a gun/to substitute for sb in sitting an examination
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
to make way (for sth)
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
